DOC.brief_summary: Uric acid is a risk factor for coronary artery disease (CED) in postmenopausal women but the association with inflammation and coronary microvascular endothelial dysfunction is not well-defined. The aim of this study was to determine the relationship of serum uric acid, inflammatory markers and CED.
DOC.brief_title: Uric Acid Levels and Endothelial Functions
DOC.criteria: Referred to Mayo Clinic for cardiac catheterization Postmenopausal History of percutaneous coronary intervention Coronary artery bypass graft surgery Unstable angina pectoris Valvular heart disease Peripheral vascular disease Known congestive heart failure
